input: scene: a pharmacy description: A centaur is inside a store. He is purchasing some things from a clerk. uncanny: Centaurs don't exist, and they probably wouldn't be allowed in stores if they did. entities: Medicine, Centaur. caption: Looks like you're already familiar with the side effects.
target: The side effect of this man's prescription drug is that it turns him into a centaur. This funny part is how nonchalant the pharmacist is about this side effect: her response is as if she sees this very unusual side effect quite regularly, and it's not a big deal. Apparently, the only action required is to be familiar with the side effect, as if it were a more benign one like drowsiness.
caption_choices: Looks like you're already familiar with the side effects.
generated_idefics: The side effects of a medicine are listed on the package, and the person in the image is reading the side effects while standing in front of a pharmacist. The pharmacist is sitting on a bench in the pharmacy.

        Cartoon description and caption: scene: a small island description: A large sperm whale is beached on a small island in the middle of the ocean. Underneath the whale is a toppled palm tree and two human feet. uncanny: Whales aren't typically so large that they can cover an entire island. Additionally, whales typically remain in the sea, and aren't usually found belly-flopped on a person. entities: Whale, Cetacean_stranding. caption: I got your message. How can I help? [/INST]
        Explanation: A joke about a message in a bottle and who is likely to receive it. Following the common "stranded on a desert island" trope, the person on the island sent out a plea for help by putting a message in a bottle, and throwing it into the ocean. However, the bottle didn't make it to a city, it was received by an unhelpful whale. The whale has their heart in the right place and came to help, but ended up just crushing the person. </s>

        <s>[INST]
        Cartoon description and caption: scene: a living room description: Two men are sitting in a living room talking. The living room also contains a large circus ring, and the men are sitting in it. uncanny: It's unusual that the living room has a giant circus ring: this wouldn't physically fit, nor does anyone actually have this in their living room. entities: Circus, Wine. caption: Welcome to the greatest living room on Earth! [/INST]
        Explanation: The slogan for the popular Ringling circus is "The Greatest Show On Earth", and while there is a circus ring here, instead of being a show, this ring doesn't contain any of the interesting parts of a circus like the animals or performers, and instead just exists in a living room. </s>

        <s>[INST]
        Cartoon description and caption: scene: a pharmacy description: A centaur is inside a store. He is purchasing some things from a clerk. uncanny: Centaurs don't exist, and they probably wouldn't be allowed in stores if they did. entities: Medicine, Centaur. caption: Looks like you're already familiar with the side effects. [/INST]
         Explanation: The joke is that centaurs are mythical creatures that do not exist in reality, so it is uncanny or unexpected to see one in a pharmacy, a place where one would expect to find real, existing things like medicine. The centaur in the cartoon is depicted as a customer purchasing items from a clerk, implying that they are shopping for real products, despite the fact that centaurs are not real. The caption adds to the humor by suggesting that the centaur is already aware of the side effects of the medication they are purchasing, implying that they are knowledgeable about real medical issues.

input: scene: a party description: A group of people are crowded around in a living room talking to one another. A man in the foreground introduces two individuals one appears to be a regular human male the other appears to be an animal. uncanny: There is a hairy, furry animal standing upright in a living room with other human beings inside. entities: Missing_link_(human_evolution), White-collar_worker. caption: You both know Jane
target: A reference to Jane Goodall. Goodall is a scientist who is famous for studying chimpanzees, as represented by the ape at the party. This party is likely a scientific conference on biology, but the unusual part is that the subject of the study, the chimp, is invited. Both the peer scientist and the chimpanzee know Goodall, but for different reasons.

A man in the foreground introduces two individuals one appears to be a regular human male the other appears to be an animal. uncanny: There is a hairy, furry animal standing upright in a living room with other human beings inside. entities: Missing_link_(human_evolution), White-collar_worker. caption: You both know Jane [/INST]
         Explanation: The caption is referencing the idea of a "missing link" in human evolution, where a transitional species between humans and other animals is suggested to have existed. In this cartoon, the "missing link" is not a biological species, but rather a person who appears to be a mix of human and animal. The punchline is that the two individuals being introduced are both human, but one of them is dressed in a suit and tie, representing a "white-collar worker," while the other is covered in fur and standing on all fours, representing a more "animalistic" nature. The humor comes from the unexpected twist on the idea of a "missing link" and the absurdity of introducing a person who is both human and not human at the same time.

input: scene: a corporate meeting room description: An executive is looking at a profit chart. Some farmers are coming into the room with a donkey. uncanny: The farmers are not dressed for the modern day. entities: Profit_(accounting), Prospecting, Retirement. caption: You the Ponzi varmint that lost our nest egg?
target: A reference to Charles Ponzi, the namesake of the "Ponzi scheme", which is a failed scam investment. Ponzi is at the desk watching profits go down, and the country folks whose money he was playing with are at the door and want answers for where their money is. A reference to how big city bankers play fast and loose with the investments of people who they will never know or meet.
caption_choices: You the Ponzi varmint that lost our nest egg?
generated_idefics: The image shows two men in a meeting, with one of them pointing at a drawing of a man on a whiteboard. The man being pointed at is likely the Ponzi varmint, who is responsible for losing the nest egg.

The farmers are dressed in outdated clothing, giving the impression that they are from a bygone era. The caption "You the Ponzi varmint that lost our nest egg?" is a play on words, combining the term "Ponzi scheme" (a type of investment scam) with the phrase "varmint" (a derogatory term for a person) to create a humorous and satirical statement. The reference to "retirement" and "prospecting" suggests that the farmers may be there to collect on a debt or investment, while the use of "profit" (accounting) implies that the executive is responsible for managing the company's finances.

input: scene: waiting room description: A man is carrying a surfboard through the room. A woman at a desk stares at him. uncanny: You do not surf in an office. entities: Secretary, Surfing. caption: Tell my 1:30 things got way gnarly...
target: A playful joke that plays upon people's desire to not work. The boss, who is usually assumed to be the most serious about work, on a whim cancels his 1:30 meeting to go surfing because the waves look good. The employees are surprised by their boss' willingness to drop everything and go surfing.
caption_choices: Tell my 1:30 things got way gnarly...
generated_idefics: The person holding the surfboard is talking to someone else in the room, and is saying that things got way too intense or exciting at the time of their appointment.

input: scene: sea description: People are in a boat paddling. A huge wave with a scary face and arms tries to get them. The Statue of Liberty is in the background. uncanny: The waves have a face and arms. entities: Rowing, Immigration, Wind_wave. caption: Row v. Wave.
target: A play on "Row v. Wade", a supreme court case which established a woman's right to access abortions. Here, the wave looks like Donald Trump, a conservative politician who is attempting to overturn row v. wade so women can't legally access abortions. And, the public in the boat who support a woman's right to choose are literally rowing a boat against the wave. So both "Row" and "Wave" have double meanings.
generated_idefics: This cartoon depicts a scene from the biblical story of Noah's Ark. In the image, Noah's ark is in the middle of a stormy sea, with the waves crashing around it. The cartoon shows a man standing on the ark, holding onto a rope, as the waves threaten to engulf the vessel.
